means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 沃尔斯 Wall的变体

sentence.Network_en: Lights reflected off dust-covered walls creating a ghostly luminescence.
sentence.Network_cn: 灯光照在满是灰尘的墙上，反射回苍白的冷光。

sentence.Network_en: Sloping walls on the bulk of the building create an optical illusion.
sentence.Network_cn: 大楼主体的斜墙给人造成一种视错觉。

sentence.Network_en: The walls have been horribly vandalized with spray paint.
sentence.Network_cn: 墙上被人用喷漆涂得乱七八糟。

entry.def: A wall is one of the vertical sides of a building or room.

example.ex: Kathryn leaned against the wall of the church...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳倚靠在教堂的墙上。

example.ex: The bedroom walls would be painted light blue...
example.tran: 卧室的墙壁会被漆成浅蓝色。

entry.def: A wall is a long narrow vertical structure made of stone or brick that surrounds or divides an area of land.

example.ex: He sat on the wall in the sun...
The well is surrounded by a wall only 12 inches high.

entry.def: The wall of something that is hollow is its side.

example.ex: He ran his fingers along the inside walls of the box.
example.tran: 他用手指摸了摸盒子的内壁。

entry.tran: 屏障;堆成墙的大量物品
entry.def: A wall of something is a large amount of it forming a high vertical barrier.

example.ex: She gazed at the wall of books...
example.tran: 她目不转睛地盯着书墙。

example.ex: I was just hit by a wall of water.

entry.def: You can describe something as a wall of a particular kind when it acts as a barrier and prevents people from understanding something.

example.ex: The police say they met the usual wall of silence...
example.tran: 警方称他们像往常一样碰了壁，没人吭气。

example.ex: Despite its prevalence, schizophrenia has existed behind a wall of secrecy for years.
example.tran: 尽管精神分裂症患者为数众多，但多年来这种病一直被捂着掩着。

entry.def: If you say that you are banging your head against a wall, you are emphasizing that you are frustrated because someone is stopping you from making progress in something.

example.ex: I appealed for help but felt I was always banging my head against a wall...
example.tran: 我寻求帮助，却发现自己处处碰壁。

example.ex: I wondered if I was banging my head against a brick wall.
example.tran: 我怀疑自己是不是在把鸡蛋往石头上碰，徒劳无益。

entry.tran: 处于困境（或绝境);走投无路
entry.def: If you have your back to the wall, you are in a very difficult situation and can see no way out of it.

example.ex: Their threat to hire replacement workers has the union with its back to the wall.
example.tran: 他们威胁说要雇用替工，这使工会陷入了困境。

entry.def: If you say that you are climbing the walls, you are emphasizing that you feel very frustrated, nervous, or anxious.

example.ex: Sitting at home would only have had him climbing the walls with frustration.
example.tran: 呆在家里只会让他沮丧得抓狂。

entry.tran: 把…逼得发疯；逼得…受不了
entry.def: If you say that something or someone is driving you up the wall, you are emphasizing that they annoy and irritate you.

example.ex: The heat is driving me up the wall...
I sang in the bath and drove my parents up the wall.
example.tran: 我在浴室里唱歌，我父母快受不了了。

entry.def: If a person or company goes to the wall, they lose all their money and their business fails.

example.ex: Even quite big companies are going to the wall these days.
example.tran: 现如今甚至有些大公司也濒临破产。

auth_sentence.content: Many of the walls have been demolished as well.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many of the walls have been demolished as well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many of the walls have been demolished as well.

auth_sentence.content: When it happens the walls of the house vibrate.
auth_sentence.res_content: When it happens the walls of the house vibrate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When it happens the walls of the house vibrate.

auth_sentence.content: Forget living outside the walls of 'the city'.
auth_sentence.res_content: Forget living outside the walls of 'the city'.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Forget living outside the walls of 'the city'.

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand,there have been hundreds of thefts and cases of deliberate damaging of public property, which usually involves breaking windows or lights or writing on walls.
